title.value: Assesment of potato parent material for the presence of markers TG689, CP113 and Gro 1-4 resistance to Globodera rostochiensis woll
Оценка исходного материала картофеля на наличие маркеров TG689, CP113 и Gro 1-4 устойчивости к золотистой картофельной нематоде Globodera rostochiensis woll

person.name: Makhanko, O.V., National Academy of Sciences of Belarus, Minsk (Belarus). Scientific and Practical Center for Potato, Vegetable and Fruit Growing
Naumovich, N.I., National Academy of Sciences of Belarus, Minsk (Belarus). Scientific and Practical Center for Potato, Vegetable and Fruit Growing

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there was realized molecular marking of the Belarusian varieties of potato (Solanum tuberosum) for the presence of H1 and Gro1-4 resistance to Globodera rostochiensis, as well as the search for the potential sources of resistance to Globodera rostochiensis among representatives of the wild species. In course of the study 47 Belarusian potato cultivars were screened for the presence of H1 and Gro 1-4 genes of resistance to golden potato nematode Globodera rostochiensis using SCAR-markers TG689, CP113 u Gro 1-4. 23 sources of H1 and 3 sources of Gro 1-4 were selected. Effectiveness of TG689 was proved (up to 91,7%). CP 113 cannot be used in the purposes of identification of H1 because of its amplification in all cultivars analyzed. Gro 1-4 was suitable for identification but had low presentation in the breeding material. 4 sources of Gro 1-4 were isolated from wild potato species collection – an accession from S. vernei and 3 accessions from S. oplocense.
